com.lakemonsters2635.actuator.interfaces

Class IDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lakemonsters2635.actuator.interfaces.IDrive
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArcadeDrive, TankDrive

    public abstract class IDrive
extends java.lang.Object
    A drive interface. Be careful what you use in your implementing class. For example, an HDrive may be made up of a RobotDrive and a SpeedController, but the middle wheel's implementation may change, so a class that is composed of an IActuator and IDrive may be preferable. On the other hand, a swerve drive is made up of a number of SpeedControllers, and changing implementation of the drive may change the entire layout of the class. Use discretion. Implementation examples include:
    A drive system driven by a PIDController.
    A swerve drive
    A car
    Author:
    Tristan Thompson
